title: ICE: repr 128 + debuginfo

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
`./src/test/ui/enum-discriminant/issue-70509-partial_eq.rs` ### Code ```Rust // run-pass #![feature(repr128, arbitrary_enum_discriminant)] //~^ WARN the feature `repr128` is incomplete #[derive(PartialEq, Debug)] #[repr(i128)] enum Test { A(Box) = 0, B(usize) = u64::MAX as i128 + 1, } fn main() { assert_ne!(Test::A(Box::new(2)), Test::B(0)); // This previously caused a segfault. // // See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/70509#issuecomment-620654186 // for a detailed explanation. } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (3694b7d30 2022-08-15) binary: rustc commit-hash: 3694b7d307b7516757651952b30bb97b6ba5c049 commit-date: 2022-08-15 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.65.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: the feature `repr128` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> ./src/test/ui/enum-discriminant/issue-70509-partial_eq.rs:2:12 | 2 | #![feature(repr128, arbitrary_enum_discriminant)] | ^^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default = note: see issue #56071 for more information ```
Backtrace
